review: I love this app, it works well for me and it‚Äôs quite user friendly and I enjoy listening to music often! Tho I would think it could help to have the capability to move groups of songs from one playlist to another at a time (together instead of just clicking on each song individually cuz that can get quite annoying sometimes), and it would nice to see some more editing control over the playlist editing functions, I wish I could just drag each songs to without scrolling to the top to press the little buttons  to edit each time I wanna change the order of tracks in a playlist! The design It has a nice streamlined feel and feels quite simple so it‚Äôs organic to use, and the features are handy as well‚Ä¶ (Like the ‚ÄòEqualizer‚Äô under the ‚ÄòPlayback‚Äô Setting on the iPhone IOS version) these tools are really handy and I would like see more like this in the future as well! This app is well designed for any musical lover or audiophile and hardly ever glitches or crashes, I hope to keep seeing new cool updates that surprise fans in the future!
title: Perfect for Listening to Music

review: I love the app and everything about it but there are some things that need work. I would like the option to select a song or music and move it to the place you want it in saved songs and playlists, just like what you do with the photos in the photo albums, because I like to listen to my music in a certain order and every now and then I add a new song and I want to put it in a certain place or I accidentally remove a song I saved and I have to save it again and remove all the songs above it and re save them to the right order and it‚Äôs just too long and hard because some songs get deleted and some aren‚Äôt the same as the ones i have, even if they have the same name and artists, so I have to save the new one and remove the old one. What‚Äôs also annoying is that they say there is now 30 minutes ad free, but most of the time it only plays 2-4 songs and then ads come up. So I want it to be a bit more accurate in the next update. I would also like it if you could add the soundtracks to the documentaries Walking With Dinosaurs and Dinosaur Revolution, Disney‚Äôs Dinosaur movie, Dot and the Kangaroo (with sequels that follow it) and some classic Australian songs because I would like to listen to them on this app. PLEASE FOLLOW THESE REQUIREMENTS FOR THE NEXT UPDATE.
title: Great app üòÑbut needs work

review:
This is a good app, I use it everyday and subscribe to premium. I‚Äôd give it 5 stars if only the daily drive worked more effectively but it‚Äôs filled with issues. 
First, there are no options for news choices, yes, the abc is a no brainer, but what happened to the squiz and betoota? They‚Äôre both excellent! Love me Betoota news! And why can‚Äôt I choose to remove some of the lousy news broadcasts selected for me? And why not allow me to select news sources from overseas?
Second, and this has made it hardly worth even bothering with, it chooses the same fifty or so songs everyday. Most of which have been deselected long ago, but they still show up, so what I end up with is a dozen songs I really like but would rather not hear every single day and a bunch of boring headlines I could read in a Murdoch rag with no real presenter charm or depth. 
What‚Äôs the solution here?
title: Daily drive algorithms glitchy

review:

I really do adore this app! I probably couldn‚Äôt go a single day without listening to music, I even pay for a few other peoples accounts so they can have everything all in one place and can listen whenever with ease. I absolutely love that I can just make a playlist for absolutely anything, have multiple people add to the same one and even them suggestions at the bottom of every playlist. It‚Äôs helped me discover things I probably never would have without it. I only wish my library had just my playlists in it or that I could pin as many as I wanted. It‚Äôs great I can like playlists/albums and follow artists but having them all scattered in the one spot is a bit of a headache, I know I can sort them but having to do that all the time especially when I‚Äôm constantly on the go is so frustrating and time consuming. Please just give us the option to pin multiple playlists, it would literally solve all mine and everyone I know‚Äôs problems with this app. üôèüèº

review:
Something that has happened the past couple months is that it will just stop playing. The song will finish and it will show the song, however the time is at 0 and if you skip, either nothing happens or it will play an ad or part of the next song without the information changing before it just drops off. So you have to completely reboot the app. And it can happen 8 times a day. Sometimes it‚Äôs after 5 songs, sometimes 15. Have not managed to get through an entire playlist. 

Thanks to the newest few updates, you can‚Äôt look at all the songs on a playlist and you can‚Äôt click on them to hear a 10 sec sample. Both are things you used to be able to do. Creating playlists are more difficult thanks to this also. The only chance you have is to add while listening to it or while creating a playlist, you know exactly what you are looking for and search for it by adding it directly. All are super annoying. Also some playlists and music seem not be available in all countries.
title: I love this app but am annoyed by a couple things

review: Okay so, what were you guys thinking?! Why did you remove the ability to check out an album with previews like you can a playlist? WHAT IDIOT HAD THAT IDEA?![Pardon my French] Your app is already going down hill, and to ‚Äúcounteract‚Äù that, you remove album previews? Now I have to go through this long ordeal of finding the songs on someone‚Äôs public playlist to see if they‚Äôre actually worth adding to my playlist, WHY WOULD YOU DO THAT?! Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I think the app is good and easy to use but, honestly, you‚Äôre just screwing yourselves over here guys. Also, I think you tend to be less inclusive of some small bands and songs, there have been multiple instances where I‚Äôve tried to find a song I like but I‚Äôve come up empty handed[Yes I have the right name]. You focus too much on mainstream music, and don‚Äôt focus enough on less, in the spotlight bands and songs. Fix it and allow us to listen to album previews again, and add less popular songs and bands, be more inclusive of that kind of stuff and I might begin to favour your app again.
title: What happened?

review:
Great app & content. But a few tweaks would make it more user friendly.
I reeeeally dislike having to click on the dots & 'add to playlist' 4 times for every playlist I want to add a song to. Surely you should be able to hit add to more than one playlist without having to go back through all the menu options again, click the dots again & add to playlist again. Not very streamlined.
Also would love a ‚Äòfast forward‚Äô or ‚Äòrewind‚Äô button like what you have on podcast apps so that you can skip through 15sec at a time instead of trying to scroll to a certain point clumsily with your fingers on a tiny dot. This is particularly hard to do when exercising.
It appears not much has changed with the functionality over the years to improve usability
title: Great content, needs work to make more user friendly

title: Music selection

review:
I listen to all sorts of music & this app is great for being able to find your way outside the usual ‚Äúbubble‚Äù. But for people who listen to classical works there are a few issues that could probably be easily improved. 
First is to be able to see who has recorded a particular piece, then choose which soloist/conductor/orchestra/choir etc to download. At the moment there‚Äôs little choice, and it‚Äôs very difficult to see (at least on my iPhone 6s+ screen) who is featured. 
Second, when I am listening to something with a lot of movements I want to see quickly which one is playing- but the scrolling info is so slow that the screen goes back to sleep before the movement number goes across - or else it‚Äôs something like the Rachmaninov variations on a theme of Paganini, with 24 short sections and the movement is finished before its number reaches the screen. Can I set it to scroll faster? Or touch it to pause & enlarge to see all the info at once? 
Third thing is lack of important info like recording date & the other things mentioned above, ho was in he band for this recording etc 
Lastly atm, I haven‚Äôt figured out how to just play my playlist and then stop - it goes on to play random stuff and totally spoils the mood. Annoying. 
But overall a good app, worth the money.

review:
Amazing app, premium is definitely worth it and I love using the app
The phone version has some flaws that need ironing though. 
Creating playlists and editing playlists should be easier on the phone. Potentially adding a feature where you can select multiple songs to add to a playlist at once. Also being able to delete a playlist from the 3 dots next to it instead of scrolling to the top. 
Also the shuffle feature sometimes feels like it‚Äôs broken, shuffling, then returning to normal, then pressing shuffle again should provide me with a fresh set of songs. Instead it shows the same 5 every time, with a couple in a different order. Additionally, sometimes these are songs I have just listened to on another device.

review: I rate this app one star, because mine is literally different to everyone else‚Äôs. All my friends and family who have this, theirs is totally different to mine. Another reason is that when I want to add a song to my playlist, it comes up with the whole album, not just the single. So I then have to add the whole album to my playlist. I‚Äôm sorry to say but I‚Äôm not very impressed with this app as everyone else is. If anyone else‚Äôs app is like this, or you know how to fix it.. please let me know.
title: Why I rate it one star.

review:
Really disappointed that there are still ads in the podcasts when you pay for premium, it‚Äôs not the ‚Äúad free‚Äù experience being advertised.
The student discount system is also flawed, I was able to get it before but then not the next time I went to renew despite uploading the same document types previously uploaded. Customer service was completely useless, they wouldn‚Äôt verify student status despite being provided with every official document requested for an institution that‚Äôs on their list. I‚Äôm a free user, so I don‚Äôt know what it is like for the Premium users. I do, however, know that if I want to listen to an album, I don‚Äôt want to be interrupted by other songs. I also don‚Äôt appreciate having to shuffle everything, and not being able to repeat songs, or backspace. I might find a really good bop in that long list of suggested songs, but even if I add it to an album, I have to shuffle so It may take a couple of songs and ads, or the suggested songs will take over and I won‚Äôt get to listen.

Overall, I think that, yes it‚Äôs good, but the experience for free users can be improved. I‚Äôm broke. I can‚Äôt afford a monthly or a yearly subscription.

review:
This app has a few major issues,
It didn‚Äôt recognise my wifi that had to be entered manually. 
The app gives you an error message in relation to the controller software.
It simply doesn‚Äôt work with either the speaker only set up or the bridge set up.
The only way I could get it working was to download controller software onto my windows laptop, set up wifi manually and the use the iphone app to join an existing system.
A novice wouldn‚Äôt have a hope. 
The app also doesn‚Äôt support the older Sonos br 100 zone bridge or zone player 5 series1. The colours referred to in their setup guide are different than on the equipment.
In summary this is a very poor app if you have older equipment. I have no idea if it‚Äôs any good on the newer equipment, you would hope so. 
On a positive note, now that I have it set up, it is working fine and I‚Äôm enjoying using it.
Hopefully this review will help others get theirs going if they have the older Sonos equipment.

title: Recent Update

review:
NOTE: this review is about the premium version.

PROS:
Instant access to more music than you could listen to in a lifetime.

It can be connected to the SoundHound app, so that any songs identified by SoundHound are automatically added to a SoundHound playlist.

Playlists based on your history help you discover new music that you‚Äôre likely to enjoy.

Regular updates to squash bugs and improve the experience.

HOW TO MAKE IT BETTER:
When changing the settings for a song (e.g. repeat), the button at the bottom of the screen should say "Done" instead of "Cancel" - you‚Äôre closing the settings, not canceling them.

Make the ‚Äúdon't like‚Äù button available on every song, just like the ‚Äúlike‚Äù button.

Make the sorting options easier to see, instead of hiding them so that they‚Äôre only visible when we pull the screen down from the top.

CONCLUSION: A great app, with a little room for improvement - 5 stars.

The app in its current state is actually pretty good, despite the loads of ads when not using premium but I‚Äôm quite used to it, and seem to enjoy it a lot.

title: Playlists

review: This app has become completely user unfriendly and utterly frustrating to use.  I can no longer find anything. The artists are impossible to find. They are not in alphabetical order even when you filter by artist. The listing makes no sense. It seems you have to actually type the names in which is impractical. I, and I'm sure lots of other people, do not remember the names of every artist I have.  The song menu is also gone. This was handy to have. Now you have like every song individually to have them come up in your songs list. The alphabetical bars were removed. They have sort of been put back but only several letters.  This app has become amateur. You‚Äôve completely ruined it.  I‚Äôm tired of paying for it.

review: The app continuously plays a handful of the songs in a playlist and then decides its going to start playing songs not in the playlist. Which means I close the app and don‚Äôt touch it for months on end. I would never ever pay for premium when this kind of issue is happening in the free version. This is supposed to be a taste of what you will get with the paid version and if that‚Äôs the case, it‚Äôs a no from me.

review:
Sherrie Fay Carter is a country lady from outback west Dubbo, NSW. Sherrie grew up on a farm and as well as her love of animals big and small her other passion is music. 

While working around the farm Sherrie listened to the greats - Slim Dusty and Dolly Parton (and let's not forget a bit of Suzi Quatro!) on her battery powered boombox. Her love and appreciation of country music has remained strong to this day. 

Sherrie's songs are heartfelt and personal. Themes include love and loss, faith, hope and acceptance.
